revised_title: Blood Volume in Mammals and its Relation to Body Surface Area
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the blood volume of various mammals, including hares, wild rabbits, and wild rats. They found that the blood volume can be better expressed as a function of the body surface area rather than as a percentage of body weight. This formula holds true for different species of mammals, indicating that lighter animals with a larger body surface have a relatively greater blood volume.
